dreisoft.tresos.lib2.api.util

Class UI

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.lib2.api.util.UI

  • public class UI
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a convenient class to help deal with UI access.
    Since:
    23.1

    • Method Detail

      • getShell

        public static org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell getShell()
        Returns:
        The current enabled shell, that is the current active shell or it's enabled descendant. Maybe null, i.e. if the application is run in headless mode.
        Since:
        23.1

      • getModalShell

        public static org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell getModalShell()
        Returns:
        the modal shell that is currently open or null, i.e. if the application is run in headless mode.
        Since:
        23.1

      • getDisplay

        public static org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display getDisplay()
        Returns:
        The current display or null, i.e. if the application is run in headless mode
        Since:
        23.1

      • run

        public static void run(dreisoft.tresos.lib2.util.swt.IR runnable)
        Runs the runnable in the default display. This method will wait until the given runnable has been executed. Will not perform anything if the application is run in headless mode. In this case an error is logged to the ErrorLog. See getDisplay() to check whether the application is run in headless mode. 
         UI.run(new IR()
 {
     @Override
     public void r() throws Exception
     {
         // your code
     }
 });
        Parameters:
        runnable - The runnable, see IR
        Since:
        23.1

      • run

        public static <T> T run(dreisoft.tresos.lib2.util.swt.RIR<T> runnable,
                        T defaultValue)
        Runs the runnable in the default display and returns the result of it. This method will wait until the given runnable has been executed. Will not perform anything if the application is run in headless mode. In this case an error is logged to the ErrorLog. See getDisplay() to check whether the application is run in headless mode. 
         UI.run(new RIR<T>()
 {
     @Override
     public T rr() throws Exception
     {
         // your code
     }
 }, defaultValue);
        If Errors or Exceptions occurred during execution, those can be queried via RIR.getOccurredThrowable().
        Parameters:
        runnable - The runnable, see RIR
        defaultValue - The default return value
        Since:
        23.1
